model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!
That's awesome! I didn't know you sang.
Yeah, it's something I've always loved to do but haven't had the chance to do it in a while.
Well, it sounds like you did a great job. What did you sing?
I sang "Amazing Grace". It's always been one of my favorites.
That's such a beautiful song. You have a great voice.
Thank you! It was really nerve-wracking, but I'm glad I did it.
I'm sure the audience loved it. You've really got some talent.
Thanks again. It's just something I do for fun, but it's nice to know people enjoy it.
Definitely. It's great to have a hobby like that. Reminds me of when you uncovered that mystery a while back. You always seem to surprise us with your skills.
Haha, yeah. I do like a good challenge. Speaking of surprises, remember when I found out you were married? That was a shocker.
Oh gosh, yes. I forget sometimes that not everyone knows. But yeah, I've been married for a few years now.
Crazy how time flies. Like when we found out Ms. Singh was leaving our school. I still can't believe that was two years ago.
I know, right? She was such a great teacher. Speaking of which, have you heard anything about her lately?
Not really. I think she moved to another state, but I'm not sure where.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Ms. Singh Leaving', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A and B discuss the news of Ms. Singh leaving the school.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, did you hear the news about Ms. Singh? ### Co-workers B: No, what about her? ### Co-workers A: She's leaving the school at the end of the year. ### Co-workers B: Oh wow, that's a shame. She was a great teacher. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, she was my favorite teacher. I'm really upset about it. ### Co-workers B: I can understand why. But you know she's been teaching for a long time, maybe she just wants to retire. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, you're right. I just wish I had more time with her.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Personal Discovery', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A informs Co-workers B about knowing of their marital status.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, Co-workers B, can I talk to you for a minute? ### Co-workers B: Sure, what's up? ### Co-workers A: I know about your wife. ### Co-workers B: Sorry, what do you mean? ### Co-workers A: I mean, I know that you're married. I saw your ring and did some research on social media. ### Co-workers B: Oh, okay. Is there a reason why you're bringing this up? ### Co-workers A: No, I just wanted you to know that I'm aware. It's nothing to worry about.' }
```
